title: 108_s1393
content: The Fruit and Vegetable Pilot Program is outlined in Section 1. The Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act is amended to include a Fruit and Vegetable Pilot Program providing free fresh fruits and vegetables to students in designated schools for several school years starting in July 2003. The Fruit and Vegetable Pilot Program aims to provide free fresh fruits and vegetables to students in selected schools, including 10,000 additional students in each State, 20,000 students in non-participating States, and 20,000 students in schools operated by tribal organizations. Schools will be selected by the Secretary for participation in the program. The Secretary will select schools for the pilot program, prioritizing those with at least 50% of students eligible for free or reduced-price meals. Schools interested in participating must provide information on the percentage of eligible students. The pilot program for school lunches requires schools to submit an application with a certification of support signed by key personnel and provide requested information. The eligibility of schools with at least 50% of students eligible for free or reduced-price meals will be determined. The Secretary will randomly select schools with at least 50% of students eligible for free or reduced-price meals to participate in the program, ensuring that the aggregate number of students meets the requirements of the subsection. The Secretary randomly selects schools with less than 50% of students eligible for free or reduced-price meals to participate in the program, ensuring that the aggregate number of students meets the requirements of this subsection. The Secretary may randomly select additional applications from schools to meet program requirements. Existing participants in the pilot program are subject to certain conditions. The pilot program under this subsection requires schools to widely publicize the availability of free fresh and dried fruits and vegetables. The Secretary must submit interim reports in specified fiscal years. The Secretary must submit interim and final reports to specified committees on the activities carried out under the pilot program requiring schools to publicize free fresh and dried fruits and vegetables. The Secretary will provide $75 per student to schools participating in the pilot program, adjusted annually based on changes in the Consumer Price Index for fresh fruits and vegetables. The Secretary will use existing funds and new funds from section 32 of the Act of August 24, 1935 to carry out the program, with amounts rounded down to the nearest dollar based on the preceding 12-month period. The Secretary will use funds from section 32 of the Act of August 24, 1935 to carry out the program. Funds made available under this paragraph for the program shall remain available until expended, and the Secretary may reallocate any unobligated or unexpended amounts.
